definition: dzi bead, a type of stone bead highly prized in Tibet for many centuries, reputed to hold supernatural power

sentences.english: Let's talk about these precious stone balls.
sentences.chinese: 我們就來說說這些天珠吧。

sentences.english: This is another reason that authentic heirloom dZi are seldom seen in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 這是另一個原因，真正的天珠傳家寶很少出現在市場。

sentences.english: But dzi beads do not remain with unlucky people.
sentences.chinese: 但是天珠不會跟隨不幸的人。

sentences.english: Nine beads is evil, and people can turn bad luck to good luck.
sentences.chinese: 九眼天珠是驅邪的，能爲人轉厄運爲吉祥。

sentences.english: Take these two balls for instance.
The exact origins and dates of dzi remain elusive.
sentences.chinese: 天珠確切的起源和年代仍然是個謎。

sentences.english: When he removed the hat, the worm had miraculously turned into a beautiful dZi.
sentences.chinese: 當他取消了帽子，蠕蟲，奇蹟般變成了美麗的天珠。

sentences.english: There is little precise information available on dzi beads.
sentences.chinese: 現在關於天珠的有價值的信息非常稀少。

sentences.english: Mythical stories are usually told to explain the origin of dzi.
sentences.chinese: 遠古的神話傳說通常被用來介紹天珠的起源。

sentences.english: But Daniel took the agate ball away with him!
sentences.chinese: 這個大牛拿着天珠就跑了。

sentences.english: He claimed that this was thanks to the dZi bead he was wearing.
sentences.chinese: 他聲稱，這是感謝天珠他穿著。

definition: jade/jade and stone/(fig.) the good and the bad
lapis lazuli (mineral of the square albite family)
Karakax County in Hotan Prefecture 和田地區|和田地区[He2 tian2 Di4 qu1], Xinjiang
